snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes concerns about the greater numbers of male editors vs. female editors on Wikipedia, Canadians suing Apple and pu...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes concerns about the greater numbers of male editors vs. female editors on Wikipedia, Canadians suing Apple and publishers and accusing them of fixing prices and a look at the scant evidence of employers asking job applicants for Facebook passwords.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Drone Lists and iPhone Rumors

byline.original: By THE REV. DR. AMY RICHTER

snippet: Three more enterprise software companies have had exceptionally strong initial public stock offerings this week, continuing last year’s trend and proving that the market has real revenue potential.
abstract: Three more enterprise software companies have had exceptionally strong initial public stock offerings this week, continuing last year’s trend and proving that the market has real revenue potential.

snippet: A reporter’s income in 2011 was higher than it was in 2010. Yet his tax rate went down. Wasn’t the opposite supposed to happen?

headline.main: In One Man’s Return, the Tax Code’s Unfairness

snippet: The first wave of quarterly results was stronger than expected, but there was caution on Wall Street ahead of data from China.
abstract: Stock market suffers moderate declines as a downturn in bank and technology shares is partially offset by solid earnings from McDonald’s, General Electric and Microsoft.

headline.main: Earnings Help Markets, but Day Ends Mixed
headline.print_headline: Earnings Help Markets, but Day Ends Mixed

snippet: Also, lawsuits over e-book pricing spread to Canada, and Rupert Murdoch is expected to testify next week on press ethics in Britain.
abstract: Also, lawsuits over e-book pricing spread to Canada, and Rupert Murdoch is expected to testify next week on press ethics in Britain.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: N.F.L. Matchups, and USA Today Journalists Become a Target

snippet: Tech earnings were in the news, with Nokia, Microsoft and Verizon Wireless all reporting their quarterly results.
abstract: Tech earnings were in the news, with Nokia, Microsoft and Verizon Wireless all reporting their quarterly results.

headline.main: Daily Report: Nokia, Microsoft and Verizon Report Earnings

snippet: Nokia reported a plunge in phone sales in the first quarter as it tries to reinvent its smartphone business.

headline.main: Nokia Logs Loss as Sales of Less Sophisticated Phones Slips
headline.print_headline: Nokia Logs Loss as Sales of Less Sophisticated Phones Slips

snippet: Longtime residents of SoHo, now a major shopping district, recall a neighborhood where the streets were deserted after dark and couples could make love in doorways without attracting attention.
abstract: SoHo is a major shopping district and trendy destination, but longtime residents recall a neighborhood that in 1979, when Etan Patz disappeared, was a gritty place where the streets were deserted after dark.

headline.main: Amid Inquiry, SoHo Recalls Less-Fashionable Past
headline.print_headline: Amid Inquiry, SoHo Recalls a Less-Fashionable Past

snippet: New jobless claims and several reports of lower-than- expected earnings pushed stock gauges lower.
abstract: Stocks fall over new jobless claims and several reports of lower-than-expected earnings.

headline.main: Signs of Weakness Send Shares Down Again
headline.print_headline: Signs of Weakness Send Shares Down Again
